page.title: 14CLEATOR MOOR - THE TOWN
page.content:
Cleator Moor is a long straggling small town, surrounded by the scenic mountains of the Lake District on one side and the rolling hills of West Cumbria of the other. Looking towards Ennerdale, the views are truly magnificent, especially if there is snow.
The town is long and narrow with a surprising number of shops. It sometimes appears very sleepy, although it certainly comes to life on Fridays when there is a busy market.
Of particular pride in the town are the fine public buildings in the market place - the library, the community hall and the town council offices and also the striking ironwork facade of the Co-operative Foodstore.
